summary.seg: This manuscript, copied in England in the late 17th century, contains a collection of brief Byzantine and patristic religious texts and excerpts, whose concerns include theological disputes and ecclesiastical organisation and appointments. It forms part of a two-volume set, of which the other is MS Dd.6.19, copied by the same hand, which contains primarily theological texts, along with historical, geographical and scientific works. In a number of cases the source manuscripts from which these texts were copied are identified, in all cases belonging to the Barocci collection of the Bodleian Library in Oxford.

Alternate pages have been left blank, perhaps with the intention of adding a facing translation which was never accomplished. The written pages are divided into two columns, of which one contains the text and the other notes on it. The person responsible for copying the manuscript was probably one R. Ray, the scholar at Trinity College whose ownership note, dated to 1693 and identical to a note in Dd.6.19, appears on f. 1r. This Ray currently remains unidentified, and no such person appears among the Fellows listed in Hugh MacLeod Innes, Fellows of Trinity College Cambridge (Cambridge, 1941). He may have been a relative of John Ray (or Wray), a notable scholar and Fellow of Trinity in the mid-17th century.

msItem.title: Errors of the Latins
msItem.rubric: f. 8r Περὶ τῶν κεφαλαίων δι'ὧν ἡ τῶν Ῥωμαίων ἐκκλησία μετὰ τὴν ἑβδόμην σύνοδον σφάλλεται οὐκ ἄτοπον ἐν συνόψει διεξελθεῖν
msItem.incipit: f. 8r αʹ Πρῶτον καὶ εσχατὸν πάντῶν, ἥ εἰς τὸ Ἅγιον Πνεῦμα βλασφημία, καὶ δύο ἀρχὰς δογματίζουσα
msItem.explicit: f. 16r τὴν ἱερὰν περιίστανται τράπεζαν, ἀνερυθριάστω πρωσώπω ἱερουργοῦντος ἱερέως
msItem.note: Note f. 16 by end of text: Signum est finis MS

msItem.author: Matthaios Blastares (1290-1360)
msItem.title: Syntagma alphabeticum rerum omnium quae in sacris canonibus comprehenduntur
msItem.note: Excerpt: ed. G.A. Rhalles and M. Potles, Σύνταγμα τῶν θείων καὶ ἱερῶν κανόνων..., 6 vols. (Athens 1852-59), vol. 6, pp. 60-61
msItem.incipit: f. 16r Σαββατιονοὶ δὲ ὧν ἠγήσατο Σαββάτιος τις πρεσβύτερος
msItem.explicit: f. 16r τἄλλα παραπλησία ἐκείνοις, κατὰ δὴ καὶ οἱ Λατῖνοι τὰ νῦν

msItem.title: Notitiae episcopatuum
msItem.note: Notitia 16 (ed. Jean Darrouzès, Notitiae episcopatuum Ecclesiae Constantinopolitanae (Paris 1981)), with some variations
msItem.filiation: This text was copied from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Barocci 205, ff. 498v-499r
msItem.rubric: f. 16r E Manuscripto Barocciano numero 205. pag. 2. folii φμζʹ. Τάξις τῶν ὑποκειμένων (γράφεται ὑπονειμένων) τῶ θρόνω τῆς Κωνσταντινουπόλεως Μητροπόλεων καὶ Ἀρχιεπισκοπῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 16r αʹ. ἡ Καισάρεια. βʹ. ἡ Ἔφεσος
msItem.explicit: f. 20v λεʹ τὰ Φάρσαλα. λϛʹ τὰ Μάτραχα
msItem.finalRubric: f. 20v Descripsi est Manusripto supra nominato, quod est magnum satis vastumque volumen in folio, charta, descriptum ante 400 et quod excurrit ασιʹ, ut videt. Differt sane quamplurimum ab editis a Carolo a S. Paulo, ut et Ph Labbe hac recensio Metropolitanorum et Archiepiscoporum

msItem.title: Verses on the Oracles of Leo the Wise
msItem.note: Also found in Venice, Biblioteca Nazionale Marciana, MS gr. XI. 006, f. 146v.
msItem.rubric: f. 22r Στίχοι εἰς τὰ Αἰνίγματα Λέοντος τοῦ σοφοῦ
msItem.explicit: f. 22r Τρισώνυμον ὄν, ἀρχῆς τε καὶ τοῦ τέλους
msItem.finalRubric: f. 22r Sequuntur ἐξηγήσεις μικραὶ εἰς τοῦς αὐτοὺς στίχους, dimidium paginae implentes

msItem.author: Nikephoros Kallistos Xanthopoulos (c. 1256-c.1335)
msItem.title: De patriarchis
msItem.filiation: This text was copied from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Barocci 142, ff. 288r-289v, line 24.
msItem.rubric: f. 22r Barocc. 142. Νικηφόρου Καλλίστου τοῦ Ξαντοπώλου εἴδησις ἀκριβεστάτη περὶ πάντων τῶν ἐν τῆ Κωνσταντινουπόλει Ἔπισκόπων καὶ Πατριαρχῶν
msItem.incipit: f. 22r Πρῶτος ὁ Ἁγιώτατος Ἀνδρέας παραγενόμενος ἐν Βυζαντίω
msItem.explicit: f. 28r μετὰ γʹ ἡμέρας καὶ ἱδράτευσεν ἔτη ιβʹ μῆνας ζʹ καὶ ἐτελευσητε
msItem.finalRubric: f. 28r Series continuatur Patriarcharum Nicephori Kallisti. pag. sequenti

msItem.author: Theodore of Stoudion (759-826)
msItem.title: Epistulae
msItem.note: Excerpt: the latter part of Letter 549 and the whole of Letter 552
msItem.filiation: This text was copied from Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS Barocci 91, ff. 331r-336v (former foliation ff. 351r-356v).
msItem.rubric: f. 28v Barocc. 91. pag. 351. Τοῦ ἁγίου Πατρὸς ἡμῶν καὶ ὁμολογητοῦ Θεοδώρου του Στουδίτου Περὶ ἀναγκαίων ζητημάτων
msItem.incipit: f. 28v Ἐρώτησις αʹ. Περὶ τῶν χειροτονηθέντων πρεσβυτέρων ἐν Ῥώμη

msItem.author: John Chrysostom (d. 407)
msItem.title: In epistulam II ad Timotheum (homiliae 1-10)
msItem.rubric: f. 42v Bar. 91. fol. 25. p. 2. Ἐκ τοῦ Λαυσιακοῦ Πατερικοῦ
msItem.incipit: f. 42v Περὶ ἱερῶν· Εἰ μὲν γὰρ δόγμα ἔχει διεστραμμένον
msItem.explicit: f. 44r ἐκείνου ταῦτα ἐτάζειν έστὶν, τοῦ σὸν· σὺ δοῦλος εἶ ἔσχατος

msItem.author: Epiphanios of Constantia (c. 310-403)
msItem.title: Panarion (Adversus haereses)
msItem.incipit: f. 44r νηʹ οὐδὲ οὐδόλως οἴδασιν. ἀλλὰ δῆθεν εἰς τὰς εὐχὰς ἐσχολακότες
msItem.explicit: f. 44r τὰ πάντα ἀδεῶς ἐργάζονται ἐσθίοντες καὶ πίνοντες

msItem.author: Matthaios Blastares (1290-1360)
msItem.title: Syntagma alphabeticum rerum omnium quae in sacris canonibus comprehenduntur
msItem.note: Excerpt: ed. G.A. Rhalles and M. Potles, Σύνταγμα τῶν θείων καὶ ἱερῶν κανόνων..., 6 vols. (Athens 1852-59), vol. 6, p. 210
msItem.rubric: f. 44r Barocc. 91. fol. 288. Περὶ τῆς τοῦ Χαρτοφύλακος τιμῆς ὅτι αὐτῶ μόνω δέδοται τῆς μεγάλης ἐκκλησίας καὶ ἐπίπροθεν πρέτη διάκονον μὴ καθεσθαι
msItem.incipit: f. 44r Μόνω γὰρ τῶ χαρτοφύλακι δέδοται τῆς μεγάλης ἐκκλησίας
msItem.explicit: f. 44r-44v καὶ τῶ ἀρχιερέων ἐν ταῖς ἔξω προκάθεσθαι συνόδοις
msItem.finalRubric: f. 44v Codici praefixum fuit hoc nomen τῶ τιμιωτάτω εὐλαβεστάτω ἱερεῖ Κυρίω Παύλω τῶ Βαροὺχ δοθῆ. demum εἰς χορίον ἀποτέτη. ιτεμ ὁ ἀδελφος καὶ συλλειτουργὸς τῆς ἁγιωσύνης Γεώργιος ἰερεὺς Ἱλωιρισι sed hac vox deleta est ut plane fere nequeat vederi, ὁ ἐξόριστος + ἔῤῥωσο. Item + ανοʹ μηνὶ Ἀπριλλίω ϛʹ εκ Βενετίας

msItem.author: Ignatios the Deacon (c. 775-c. 848)
msItem.title: Drama de primi parentis lapsu
msItem.rubric: f. 46r Στίχοι Ιγνατίου εἰς Ἀδὰμ πρὸς τὸν φίλον συμφοραῖς περιπεσόντα ποιεῖται τὸ ποιημα
msItem.incipit: f. 46r Ἀγῶνας, ἆθλα καὶ παλαίσματα βλέπων
msItem.explicit: f. 52r Ἕως ἐὼν γῆς γεγενῆς παλινδρόμε
msItem.finalRubric: f. 52r Antecedens MS. desumptum est libro Langbaini numero 2. extatque in Bibliotheca Publici Oxonii, item sequenti Margine adscriptum praetulit notam: Reverendissimo Patrono Archiepiscopo Armachano extare (quicquid id erat) sub Ignatii nomine versus in Adam in Bibliotheca Regis Galliarum inde plenus Vir CL. et de Ignatio optimi meritus (haec secunda note alia manu ibidem notata) per Bootium describendum curavit, exemplar transmissum mecum, illico communicavit, Qui hic descripsi, 1648

msItem.author: Matthaios Blastares (1290-1360)
msItem.title: Syntagma alphabeticum rerum omnium quae in sacris canonibus comprehenduntur
msItem.note: Excerpt: ed. G.A. Rhalles and M. Potles, Σύνταγμα τῶν θείων καὶ ἱερῶν κανόνων..., 6 vols. (Athens 1852-59), vol. 6, p. 247
msItem.rubric: f. 52r Φωτίου τοῦ Πατριαάρχου καὶ Θεοδώρου τοῦ Στουδίτου περὶ προσκυνήσεως εἰκόνων
msItem.incipit: f. 52r Ἡ μὲν ἐν πνεύματι καὶ ἀληθεία λατρεία
msItem.explicit: f. 52r ἵνα μὴ κοσμολάτραι, καὶ ὑλολάτραι δόξωμεν

support.note: Given the manner in which different types of paper are interspersed within quires, it often cannot be reliably determined to which type leaves without watermarks belong, and this reconstruction is in part conjectural.
support.material: ff. 1-7, 15, 17-21, 25, 29, 41-45, 48-49, 53-54, 56, 58-59, 61 Western paper, folded in quarto. Watermark: Foolscap ( c. 100 35 ) in the gutter, similar but not identical to Heawood 2071, 2077. These examples are dated to 1705.

ff. 8-14, 16, 22-24, 26-28, 30-40, 46, 50-52 Western paper, folded in quarto. Watermark: Coat of arms ( c. 65 45 ) in the gutter, similar to Heawood 456, 458-460, 473, but including only the main motif without countermarks. These examples are dated to 1670-1713.
ff. 47, 55, 57, 60 Western paper, folded in quarto. Watermark: Letters (RB) ( c. 20 30 ) in the gutter.

supportDesc.foliation: The manuscript is foliated with the numbers 1-61, in pencil, in Arabic numerals, recto, upper right, apart from ff. 1-2, where the folio number appears in the lower right.

collation.p: The manuscript consists of 8 quires, of which one is a ternion, three are quaternia and four are quinia.

list.item: Quire 18-2 ff. 1-6 The first and third folios have been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 210-1 ff. 7-15 The sixth folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 38-1 ff. 16-22 The fifth folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 410-2 ff. 24-30 The fifth and tenth folios have been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 510-1 ff. 31-39 The sixth folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.
Quire 68-1 ff. 40-46 The fifth folio has been cancelled, without loss of text.

supportDesc.condition: There is pest damage to the lower edge of the first few folios (left pastedown-f. 5) and occasional staining and areas of dirt.

layoutDesc.layout:
Two columns of 21-32 lines. The main text appears in the inner column, notes on content and emendations in the narrower outer column. Alternate folios are ruled but blank, perhaps intended for a translation. 155 120
Margins and column division ruled in pencil.

handNote.p: The manuscript was copied, probably by R. Ray, in a western European mixed minuscule script imitating early printing.

additions.p: An ownership note dated 1693 has been added on f. 1r: R: Ray. C.T.C. 1693, together with the classmark.
Numbers in brown ink occasionally appear on the recto, upper right, some of which have been partially lost to cropping: 9 on f. 16r, 19 on f. 24r, 33 (?) on f. 40r, 42 on f. 48r.
Otherr numbers in pencil occasionally appear on the recto, lower right: 11 on f. 18r, 25 on f. 25r, 21 on f. 28r, 31 on f. 38r, 41 on f. 48r, 50 on f. 50r, 45 on f. 52r, 61 on f. 61r.

binding.p: 17th-century full leather binding, with decorative blind tooling on both board and gold tooling on the spine and edges. The classmark appears on labels on the spine.
binding.condition: Both outer joints are partially split.

history.origin: The manuscript was copied in the second half of the 17th century, before 1693, as indicated by the watermarks and the ownership note on f. 1r. The early owner recorded by this note, R. Ray, a student or fellow of Trinity College, Cambridge, may well have copied it himself for his own use. In any case it was produced in England, as indicated by its English watermark.
history.acquisition:
Possibly presented in 1715 by George I George I, King of Great Britain, 1660-1727 , as part of the collection of John Moore (b. 1646, d. 1714), bishop of Ely Moore, John, 1646-1714 . This is suggested by the presence inside the left board of the bookplate used for this collection. However, this bookplate was sometimes incorrectly placed in manuscripts which did not belong to this collection, and this manuscript is not recorded as part of it in Bernard, Catalogi librorum manuscriptorum Angliæ et Hiberniæ (1697), nor in the handwritten supplementary list of Moore’s manuscripts, now MS Oo.7.50(2), compiled by
Thomas Tanner Tanner, Thomas, 1674-1735 .

recordHist.source: Description draws on A catalogue of the Manuscripts preserved in the Library of the University of Cambridge, vol. 1, (Cambridge, 1856), pp. 297-298.

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card. For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Joining the Library). For further information on the availability of the manuscript, please contact the Manuscripts Reading Room.

monogr.title: A catalogue of the manuscripts preserved in the library of the University of Cambridge
